testcase.brief: Port forwarding for tcp (ssh, ftp, web server, remote desktop ….)
testcase.description:
Topology to use Topo4 Description Port forwarding for tcp (ssh, ftp, web server, remote desktop ….) Platform Dependence BR100,BR200,BRAP330,BRAP350 Pre-condition 1. Wan interface eth0 get ip on br 2. Nat enable on wan interface 3. Pc1 connect to br lan interface and get lan subnet ip address 4. BR100 connect to br lan interface and get lan subnet ip address 5. Pc2 connect to external network on br and pc2 can reach br wan interface Test procedure 1. Configure 1 port forwarding nat policy for ssh tcp on br ip nat-policy ssh type virtual-host inside-host 192.168.1.10 inside-port 22 outside-port 2002 protocol tcp
2. apply the port forwarding nat policy on wan interface interface eth0 mode wan nat-policy ssh
3. pc2 send tcp port 2002 connection to eth0 ip address of br, check result1 4. no the port forwarding on wan interface eth0 , check result 2 no interface eth0 mode wan nat-policy ssh
5. pc2 send tcp port 2002 connection to eth0 ip address of br, again, check result 3 Expect result 1. pc2 connect to br100 ssh server and can manage the br100 through ssh 2. the ssh connection is disconnected on pc2 3. pc2 can’t connect to br100 ssh server and can’t manage the br100 through ssh

step.desc: ${br1.br.wan.int1} pppoe get ip
show interface ${br1.br.wan.int1} pppoe ,pppoe get the ip address
get ${br1.br.wan.int1} ip of br
config static route to br pppoe ip on mpc
configure mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: set eth1 with access mode
step.telnet: -v "user-profile auto1" -v "user-profile auto1 vlan-id ${br1.vlan1} attribute 1" -v "security-object lan1" -v "security-object lan1 default-user-profile-attr 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport mode access " -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport user-profile-attribute 1 "

step.desc: br1.vpc1 gets ip addr
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
1. Configure 1 port forwarding nat policy for ssh tcp on br
step.telnet: -v "ip nat-policy auto${job.id} type virtual-host inside-host ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} inside-port 22 outside-port 65534 protocol tcp" -v "interface ${br1.br.wan.int1} mode wan nat-policy auto${job.id}"

step.desc: check the nat policy and open debug on br
step.telnet: -v "show ip nat-policy auto${job.id}" -v "show ip iptables nat" -v "_ff id 1 dst-ip ${br.ext_srv.ip} bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail"

step.desc: external PC2 ssh to PC1,ssh should be successful
show log buf
no the port forwarding on wan interface ${br1.br.wan.int1}
external PC2 ssh to PC1,ssh should be failed when there are not the port-forwarding nat-policy on the wan interface
step.log-match: -re -e "(ssh: connect to host ${br1.br.wan.ip} port 65534: Connection refused|SSH failed)"

step.desc: show log buf
bind the nat-policy on ${br1.br.wan.int1} ,again.there are the port-forawrding on iptables
step.console: -v "interface ${br1.br.wan.int1} mode wan nat-policy auto${job.id}" -v "" -v "show ip iptables nat"

step.desc: disable ${br1.br.wan.int1} pppoe get ip ,there are not the port-forwarding on iptables
step.console: -v "no interface ${br1.br.wan.int1} pppoe enable" -v "" -v "show ip iptables nat" -v "no interface ${br1.br.wan.int1} mode wan nat-policy auto${job.id}" -v "" -v "show ip iptables nat"

step.desc: enable ${br1.br.wan.int1} pppoe get ip ,but not bind the nat-policy on ${br1.br.wan.int1},there are not the port-forwarding on iptables
external PC2 ssh to PC1,ssh should be failed when there are not the port-forwarding nat-policy on the wan interface
step.log-match: -re -e "(ssh: connect to host ${br1.br.wan.ip} port 65534: Connection refused|SSH failed)"

step.desc: delete static route to br pppoe ip on mpc
delete static route to br pppoe ip on external PC2
delete static route to br pppoe ip on mpc
delete static route to br pppoe ip on external PC2
